verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:13
verses.text: Otherwise I should have wrought falsehood against mine own life: for there is no matter hid from the king, and thou thyself wouldest have set thyself against me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:14
verses.text: Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:15
verses.text: And ten young men that bare Joab’s armour compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:16
verses.text: And Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel: for Joab held back the people.
